text: Fred Dalton Thompson (Freddie Dalton Thompson; August 19, 1942 - November 1, 2015) was an American politician, actor, attorney, and lobbyist. Thompson was born at Helen Keller Memorial Hospital in Sheffield, Alabama, He become famous during the 1970s during the Watergate Scandal because he discovered the Watergate tapes which would lead to President Richard Nixon's resignation in 1973. He starred on Law & Order as Arthur Branch, the District Attorney of New York. He quit the show to run as the Republican candidate for the United States presidency in 2008, but he did not become the candidate. He was also the host of The Fred Thompson Show, one of Westwood One's most popular talk shows. On November 1, 2015, Thompson died from non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL), a form of cancer, at the age of 73 in Nashville, Tennessee. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1942 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from Alabama Category:American lobbyists Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Cancer deaths in Tennessee Category:Deaths from non-Hodgkin lymphoma Category:People from Sheffield, Alabama Category:Politicians from Alabama Category:2008 United States presidential candidates Category:United States senators from Tennessee
title: Fred Thompson
